intro: Elatostema urvilleanum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema urvilleanum is known for its ability to thrive in humid conditions and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
